alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Marion; Panola (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEBSTER...NORTHERN DE SOTO...RED RIVER...NORTH CENTRAL NATCHITOCHES...CADDO...WESTERN CLAIBORNE... BIENVILLE AND BOSSIER PARISHES...SOUTHEASTERN MARION...EASTERN HARRISON AND NORTHEASTERN PANOLA COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 AM CDT... At 1020 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Homer to near Sibley to near Waskom. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Homer, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Haynesville, Waskom, Coushatta, Benton, Stonewall, Ringgold, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Oil City, Gibsland, Sarepta, Doyline, and Mooringsport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
